channel.title: May Helena Plumb
channel.description: May Helena Plumb is a linguist who studies Zapotec languages.

item.title: The egg
item.description:
A banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa. In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called “plantains”, distinguishing them from dessert bananas.

The fruit is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich in starch covered with a rind, which may be green, yellow, red, purple, or brown when ripe.

item.title: A post in the future
item.description:
What happens if a make some more posts, but in the future? I want them to look nice. Here is an example of a jargon word. And I’m going to add a footnote. And some text after, so I can see some more.

Here’s some more text in a new paragraph.

item.title: The Banana
item.description:
A banana is an edible fruit – botanically a berry – produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa. In some countries, bananas used for cooking may be called “plantains”, distinguishing them from dessert bananas.

The fruit is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich in starch covered with a rind, which may be green, yellow, red, purple, or brown when ripe.

item.title: A past post about fruit
item.description:
What if I put a post in the past? Where does it go?

The fruit is variable in size, color, and firmness, but is usually elongated and curved, with soft flesh rich in starch covered with a rind, which may be green, yellow, red, purple, or brown when ripe.
